DataElementConcept.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire Last 24 Hours How Much Relief Received from Treatment or Medication Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire._A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero._A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A question about how much pain relief an individual is receiving or has received from treatment or medication.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Concepts.longName: Questionnaire Domain
Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Property.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire Last Integer Hour How Much Relief Received from Treatment or Medication Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale.:Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.:A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:A question about how much pain relief an individual is receiving or has received from treatment or medication.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.longName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale.

Concepts.longName: Last
Concepts.definition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.

Concepts.longName: Integer
Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

Concepts.longName: Hour
Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.

Concepts.longName: How Much Relief Received from Treatment or Medication
Concepts.definition: A question about how much pain relief an individual is receiving or has received from treatment or medication.

Concepts.longName: Score
Concepts.definition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. ylu

ValueDomain.preferredName: BPI Percentage Relief From Pain Treatment or Medication Score 11 Point Likert Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard for the subjective scoring of the percentage of relief from pain medication or treatment that ranges from 0%: No Relief to 100%: Complete Relief.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: BPI Percentage Relief From Pain Treatment or Medication Likert Scale Scale
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A scale for the subjective scoring of the percentage of relief from pain medication or treatment that ranges from 0%: No Relief to 10: Complete Relief.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.longName: BPI Percentage Relief From Pain Treatment or Medication Likert Scale
Concepts.definition: A scale for the subjective scoring of the percentage of relief from pain medication or treatment that ranges from 0%: No Relief to 10: Complete Relief.

Concepts.longName: Scale
Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: In the last 24 hours, how muc
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the last 24 hours, how much relief have pain treatments or medications provided? Please circle the one percentage that shows how much RELIEF you have received.
